title: Small Manufacturers Competitiveness Fund (SMCF)
agency: Connecticut Dept of Economic and Community Development
description: Provides financial assistance to small manufacturer's to help them compete against out-of-state and foreign manufacturers.  Funds may be used for machinery and equipment, inventory purchases, and working capital.

title: Manufacturing Modernization Loan Program
agency: Illinois Dept of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
description: Provides manufacturers with access to adequate and affordable financing for upgrading and modernizing their manufacturing equipment and operations.

title: Emerging Technology Fund
description: Supports innovation and growth in Massachusetts by providing loans and guarantees for technology-based manufacturing facilities and equipment.

title: Small Business Development Loan Program
agency: Minnesota Dept of Employment and Economic Development
description: Provides financing for industrial and manufacturing businesses in Minnesota. Loans up to a maximum of $5 million may be made for any one business. Generally, 20 percent of the project costs must be privately financed through equity or other sources.

title: Industrial Development Authority
agency: Pennsylvania Dept of Community & Economic Development
description: Centers provide support for deployment of technology, manufacturing growth opportunities and productivity improvements. Services and programs include new product development, market development/lead generation, sales development, business strategy, process improvement, supplier development, training, information technology and sustainable manufacturing practices (energy efficiency, green mfg).

title: Research and Development Loan Program
description: Loans for businesses engaged in laboratory, scientific or experimental testing and development related to new products, new uses for existing products, or improving existing products.

title: Major Business Expansion Bond Program
description: Provides long-term, credit-enhanced financing up to $25,000,000 at taxable bond rates for businesses creating or retaining 50 jobs and long-term, tax-exempt bond rates on bonds of up to $10,000,000 that are used to finance manufacturing expansions.

title: Revenue Obligations Securities Program
description: Provides manufacturing borrowers with State access to tax-exempt bond financing and is ideally suited when the borrower proposes to arrange its own credit enhancement.

title: Secondary Market Taxable Bond Program
description: Provides long-term bond financing on loans of for real estate and machinery and equipment acquisitions. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.

title: Secondary Market Tax-Exempt Bond Program
description: Provides tax-exempt interest rate bond financing for manufacturing borrowers. Loan amount available up to 90% of the project debt. FAME exposure to any one relationship may not exceed $4,750,000.

title: Demonstration Fund
description: Provides grants and loans to accelerate commercialization of products by companies in three targeted industry clusters:  bioscience, manufacturing and information technology. The purpose of the fund is to encourage commercialization of innovation thereby fostering competitive, profitable companies that create high paying jobs and wealth in Iowa.

title: Networking Fund
description: Provides financial assistance to support networking events within the targeted industries of advanced manufacturing, biosciences, or information technology that generate new innovations, partnerships, and deal flow.

title: Supply Chain Development
description: Awards of up to $100,000 are available to encourage manufacturing supply chain development initiatives in the following targeted industries: biosciences, information technology, and advanced manufacturing.

title: Third Frontier Project
description: Information venture and seed capital funding for technology research and development and commercialization.

title: Statewide Loan Pool Program
description: Provides loans to help manufacturing and hi-tech firms expand and create and maintain jobs in a targeted New Jersey municipalities.

title: Trade Adjustment Assitance Program
agency: Arizona Department of Commerce/Western Trade Adjustment Assistance Center (WTAAC)
description: The Trade Adjustment Assistance Program provides grants to manufacturing and producing companies which have experienced declines in sales and employment partially due to foreign competition.  Eligible applicants must be an autonomous legal entity, have US operations, and have been in business for at least two years. Based on two 12-month periods that ended within the last 120 days, a company must show that total net sales and monthly employee headcount have declined as a result of imports.

title: Venture Capital for Entrepreneurs
description: Provides financial assistance to a variety of companies in the manufacturing, service and retail sectors.
